intro: Aureolaria purpurea, commonly known as purple sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, typically from June to August. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Aureolaria purpurea is an annual herb that thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
